dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.title: Description
dataObjects.rightsHolder: Missouri Botanical Garden, 4344 Shaw Boulevard, St. Louis, MO, 63110 USA
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Flora of Pakistan Vol. 0: 6 in eFloras.org, Missouri Botanical Garden. Accessed Nov 12, 2008.
dataObjects.description: A caulescent, glabrous herb. Leaves radical, grass-like, linear, 10-35 cm long, 5-10 mm broad, setose-acute. entire, 5-7 (-9)-nerved, membranous. Flowers bisexual, solitary. Spathe 4-6 (-10) cm long, lobes obtuse; peduncles as long as or longer than leaves, terete. Sepals linear, (6-) 7-15 mm long, ± cucullate at apex. Petals 1.5-2 cm long. Stamens 3, filaments 3-6 mm long, with c. 1-2 mm long, linear anthers. Ovary as long as spathe, with up to 10 cm long rostrum; styles 6-10 mm long. Furit linear, 3-6 cm long. Seeds elliptic, 1-2 mm long, with 8 longitudinal rows of obscure tubercles or smooth, not tailed at the ends.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.title: Description
dataObjects.rightsHolder: Missouri Botanical Garden, 4344 Shaw Boulevard, St. Louis, MO, 63110 USA
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Flora of North America Vol. 22 in eFloras.org, Missouri Botanical Garden. Accessed Nov 12, 2008.
dataObjects.description: Stems 0.5--3 cm. Leaves 2.5--60 ´ 0.2--1.2 cm, margins finely serrate, apex acute. Inflorescences: peduncles to 50 cm [sessile]; spathe flattened. Flowers mostly solitary, rarely paired, projected to water surface; stamens 3. Fruits terete, 20--80 ´ to 5 mm. Seeds 1.2--1.8 mm.
